processed_nodes.problem_description: The node 'To-do list' is under-specified (no attributes, no description), weakly connected (only 1 edge), and likely duplicates another node with the same label in its neighborhood. It should either be merged with the neighbor or disambiguated (e.g., as 'Jukka’s to-do list'), and enriched with core attributes and relationships (owner, tool, included tasks). Quality metrics are present; no critical temporal data is required for an Entity.
processed_nodes.resolution_notes:
Recommended repair actions:
- Verify identity and naming:
  - Confirm if this node’s human-readable name/title is 'To-do list'; if missing, add a name attribute. Resolve the mismatch between the UUID label and the referenced name.
  - Determine whether this node is an instance (a specific task list) or a class/concept. If instance, set a more specific type (e.g., TaskList/Document) instead of generic Entity.
- Duplicate check:
  - Search for nodes with same/similar title ('to-do list', case-insensitive, normalized) within the same scope (owner/project/tool). Use attributes like owner/tool/project to disambiguate.
  - If a true duplicate exists, merge: choose canonical node, merge attributes/edges, preserve provenance, and deprecate the duplicate with a redirect.
- Enrichment if kept:
  - Core attributes: name/title, description, owner (Person), tool/app (e.g., Notion/Trello), project/context, created_at, updated_at, source URI, language, confidence score, provenance/source.
  - Relationships: OwnedBy->Person, PartOf->Project, RepresentedIn/UsesTool->Application/Board, Contains->Task items, SameAs/EquivalentTo if applicable.
- Structural integrity:
  - Connect it meaningfully or mark for archival/deletion if no supporting information can be found.
  - Recompute and validate edge count; fix any indexing issues causing the analyzer to see 1 edge.
- Governance:
  - Apply naming convention for disambiguation (e.g., "<Owner> – To-do list (<Tool>/<Project>)").
  - Update type from generic 'Entity' to a precise class and ensure category alignment.
